topics.body:
"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54eebd6a636872745e314300#post_54eebd6a636872745e314300
[bq="Shadow the Hedgehog"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54eebcc66368722ef5eb1300#post_54eebcc66368722ef5eb1300
Then the only think we need to do is destroy the internet and the world will be happy again :D[/bq]
At this point trying to get rid of the internet might as well be like trying to kill a metaphorical god because it's a non-physical idea given to name the electronic pulses of a hundred billion devices interconnected with each other that causes and is effected by the organic components that connect to it that in of itself are networks of neural electrical activity that all work together to give rise to memetic thoughts that are shared and transmitted to each other.

Basically I doubt the human race would be able to function anymore without the internet and yes that is true cause being connected to the internet actually phsyically effects your brain permanently.

That's probably why people are so scared of the internet is that it's become a metaphorical god that either directly or indirectly changes the lives of everyone on the planet and special interest groups are terrified at the idea of the realization that they have no actual power at all.
